resources.name: DeepLabCut Model Zoo (Mackenzie Mathis, Hugging Face)
resources.description: A collection of DeepLabCut pre-trained models for a wide array of animals, maintained by Mackenzie Mathis. Includes models for quadrupeds, mice, birds, humans, macaques, primates, horses, and more. See the Hugging Face profile for the full list and details.

resources.name: DeepLabCut Organization (Hugging Face)
resources.description: The official DeepLabCut organization on Hugging Face, hosting models and demos for animal pose estimation. Supports a wide array of species and provides links to the Model Zoo and related resources.

resources.name: Using DeepLabCut for 3D Markerless Pose Estimation
resources.description: Guidance on DLC for 3D pose estimation.

resources.name: DeepLabCut: Markerless Pose Estimation
resources.description: Foundational paper on DLC technology.

resources.name: DeeperCut: Multi-person Pose Estimation
resources.description: High-performance multi-person pose estimation.

resources.name: SuperAnimal-Quadruped-80K
resources.description: Dataset aggregating quadruped animal images.

resources.name: SuperAnimal-TopViewMouse-5K
resources.description: Dataset aggregating top-view mouse images.

resources.name: DeepLabCut Benchmarks
resources.description: Various benchmarks for animal pose estimation including TRI-MOUSE, PARENTING-MOUSE, MARMOSETS, FISH, HORSE-30.

resources.name: Animal Pose Estimation Leaderboard
resources.description: Comparative leaderboard for animal pose estimation methods.

resources.name: DeepLabCut Leaderboard
resources.description: Comparative leaderboard for DLC benchmarks.

resources.name: idtracker.ai
resources.description: Open-source multi-animal tracking software that can identify and track up to 100 unmarked animals in video, maintaining individual identities throughout the recording.

resources.name: SimBA - Simple Behavioral Analysis
resources.description: Open-source pipeline and GUI for developing supervised behavioral classifiers. Supports DLC, DeepPoseKit, SLEAP, MARS and others.

resources.name: Bonsai
resources.description: Visual programming language for synchronizing and processing heterogeneous data streams in real time

resources.name: LabStreamingLayer (LSL)
resources.description: Middleware framework for streaming and synchronizing multiple data sources (e.g. EEG, motion tracking, video, etc.) over a network.

resources.name: Open Ephys
resources.description: Open-source platform for electrophysiology hardware and software.

resources.name: CEBRA: Consistent EmBeddings of high-dimensional Recordings using Auxiliary variables
resources.description: Machine-learning method that can be used to compress time series in a way that reveals otherwise hidden structures in the variability of the data

resources.name: DeepLabCut
resources.description: Open-source toolbox for markerless pose estimation of animals using deep learning, allowing high-accuracy tracking of user-defined body parts across species.

resources.name: SLEAP (Social LEAP Estimates Animal Poses)
resources.description: Open-source multi-animal pose tracking toolkit that uses deep learning to estimate positions of animal body landmarks, enabling tracking of multiple animals without markers.

resources.name: DeepPoseKit
resources.description: Python toolkit for animal pose estimation using deep learning, providing a user-friendly way to train networks for tracking body landmarks in videos.

resources.name: JAABA (Janelia Automatic Animal Behavior Annotator)
resources.description: Machine learning-based software for analyzing and classifying animal behaviors from video data; allows users to train classifiers to recognize specific behaviors (originally developed for fruit fly studies).

resources.name: MARS (Mouse Action Recognition System)
resources.description: Deep learning pipeline for automated pose estimation and social behavior classification in mice. MARS tracks multiple mice and identifies behaviors like attack, mounting, and investigation in pairwise interactions.

resources.name: BENTO (Behavior Ensemble and Neural Trajectory Observatory)
resources.description: Matlab-based interface for synchronizing and visualizing multimodal data streams (video, pose, neural recordings, audio, etc.), allowing researchers to link neural activity with behavioral events.

resources.name: Motion Sequencing (MoSeq)
resources.description: Unsupervised behavior analysis method that decomposes 3D animal motion into sequences of repeatable modules or 'syllables'. Provides tools for depth-video capture and analysis to characterize spontaneous behaviors in mice.

resources.name: OpenPose
resources.description: Real-time multi-person 2D pose estimation library. OpenPose detects human body, hand, and facial keypoints in video, widely used for analyzing human posture and movements in natural interactions.

resources.name: OpenFace
resources.description: Open-source tool for facial behavior analysis. It can track facial landmarks, head pose, eye gaze, and facial action units, facilitating analysis of expressions and attention in human social interactions.

resources.name: DeepSqueak
resources.description: Deep learning-based software for detecting and analyzing ultrasonic vocalizations. Commonly used to automatically identify rodent calls in audio recordings, aiding studies of communication and affective state.

resources.name: Anipose
resources.description: Open-source toolkit for 3D pose estimation from multiple camera views.

resources.name: OpenBehavior
resources.description: Community-driven repository and blog highlighting open-source neuroscience tools and behavioral research methods. OpenBehavior aggregates resources for tracking, analysis, and hardware across species.

resources.name: OpenNeuro
resources.description: Free and open platform for sharing neuroscience data (primarily human brain imaging and electrophysiology) in BIDS format.

resources.name: DANDI Archive
resources.description: Data archive for neurophysiology and neuroimaging data, supporting the Neurodata Without Borders (NWB) format. DANDI enables sharing and reuse of large multimodal neuroscience datasets, aligning with FAIR data principles.

resources.name: NIMH Data Archive (NDA)
resources.description: Central repository for human subjects data (e.g., ABCD study) including behavioral, clinical, and neuroimaging data. NDA operates under controlled access with data use agreements, providing governance for sharing sensitive human data.

resources.name: Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS)
resources.description: A standard for organizing and describing neuroscience data to facilitate sharing and analysis.

resources.name: Neurodata Without Borders (NWB)
resources.description: Open standard format for neurophysiology data (neural recordings, behavioral events, etc.) to enhance sharing and integration.

resources.name: Neuro Behavior Ontology (NBO)
resources.description: Ontology of human and animal behaviors and behavioral phenotypes.

resources.name: Hierarchical Event Descriptors (HED)
resources.description: Standardized tagging system for events and metadata in experiments. HED tags provide a consistent way to label events (e.g., stimuli, actions) in neurobehavioral datasets, improving interoperability and analysis.

resources.name: NIH BRAIN Initiative Neuroethics Guiding Principles
resources.description: Eight principles outlining ethical considerations for brain research, emphasizing safety, autonomy, privacy of neural data, and public engagement.

resources.name: Open Brain Consent
resources.description: Initiative providing standardized consent language and tools to facilitate sharing of human brain data.

resources.name: BRAIN Initiative Data Sharing Ecosystem (2024)
resources.description: Overview and analysis of the NIH BRAIN Initiative's data archive ecosystem, comparing seven major neurodata repositories and discussing challenges in making neuroscience data more FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable).

categories.name: Pose Estimation
categories.description: Techniques and resources for analyzing animal and human pose.

categories.description: Pre-trained models for various applications.

categories.description: Scientific publications related to behavioral research.

categories.name: Benchmark
categories.description: Standard tests for comparing model performance.

categories.description: Platforms comparing algorithm performance.

categories.name: Entity Tracking
categories.description: Tools and methods for tracking individual entities in videos or experiments.

categories.name: Behavioral Analysis
categories.description: Software and techniques for analyzing behavioral data.

categories.name: Experimental Design
categories.description: Resources related to designing experiments.

categories.name: Hardware

categories.name: Neural Data
categories.description: Resources related to the analysis of neural data.

categories.name: Data Analysis
categories.description: Tools and techniques for analyzing various types of data.

categories.name: Audio Analysis
categories.description: Tools and techniques for analyzing audio data.

categories.name: Community Resource
categories.description: Platforms and repositories serving the broader research community.

categories.name: Data Repository
categories.description: Platforms for storing, sharing, and accessing datasets.

categories.name: Data Sharing
categories.description: Resources related to the principles and practices of sharing research data.

categories.name: Ethics and Governance
categories.description: Guidelines, principles, and standards related to ethical conduct and data governance in research.

categories.name: Facial Analysis
categories.description: Tools and techniques for analyzing facial features, expressions, and movements.

categories.name: Ontology
categories.description: Formal naming and definition of types, properties, and interrelationships of entities for a particular domain.

categories.name: Data Standard
categories.description: Specifications or protocols for organizing, formatting, and describing data to ensure consistency and interoperability.

animals.name: Multi-Animal
animals.description: Experiments or tools involving multiple animals simultaneously.

animals.name: Fly
animals.description: Insects of the order Diptera (e.g., Drosophila melanogaster).
